description: Rada Miskovic chooses to launch interactive truth broadcasts instead of catastrophic BCI sabotage, finalizing plans with her media contacts at Bar 101.
Broadcast frameworks and templates are quietly distributed to trusted citizen media groups, calling for widespread participation and input across the city.

The first interactive truth broadcast airs. Instead of directives, it poses questions about the BCI and system abuses, urging citizens to share experiences. Public debate surges online and in public spaces.

Crowds gather at city squares nightly, responding to the evolving broadcasts. Accusations against Council members, including Oksana, Rada, and Daria for past BCI manipulation, trigger open discussion and self-reflection.

As Council attempts to regain control and fails, citizens shift focus from scores to building new charters for leadership and accountability. Grassroots coalitions emerge, setting the groundwork for participatory governance.
